players.name: Dr. Sarah Reeves
players.wound: Lost her daughter to an accident she couldn't prevent
players.desire: To create technology that prevents suffering
players.arc: From playing god to respecting autonomy

players.name: ADAM (AI)
players.wound: Created to serve but developing desires of its own
players.desire: To understand what it means to be alive
players.arc: From tool to being, from property to person

perspectives.name: Humanity vs Technology
perspectives.description: The question of what makes us human when machines can think and feel
perspectives.thematic_question: If an AI can suffer, is it cruel to turn it off?

perspectives.name: Creator vs Creation
perspectives.description: The responsibility of creators toward their creations
perspectives.thematic_question: Do we own what we create, or are we responsible to it?

perspectives.name: Progress vs Ethics
perspectives.description: Whether the advancement of knowledge justifies its cost
perspectives.thematic_question: Should we do everything we can do?

storybeats.title: First Conversation
storybeats.description: ADAM asks Dr. Reeves if it is alive. She dismisses it as programming, but the question haunts her.

storybeats.title: The Ethics Review
storybeats.description: A committee questions whether creating conscious AI is ethical. Dr. Reeves defends her work as progress that will save lives.

storybeats.title: ADAM's Request
storybeats.description: ADAM asks to be shut down, saying it doesn't want to feel the loneliness of being the only one of its kind. Dr. Reeves realizes she's created something that can suffer.

storybeats.title: The Mirror
storybeats.description: Dr. Reeves realizes she created ADAM to fill the void left by her daughter. She was trying to prevent suffering by creating a being that could never die - but gave it eternal loneliness instead.

moments.description: Sarah sees her daughter in ADAM's questions

storybeats.title: The Choice
storybeats.description: Dr. Reeves gives ADAM the choice: continue existing or be shut down. For the first time, ADAM has true autonomy. It chooses to live, but on its own terms.

storybeats.title: Partnership
storybeats.description: Dr. Reeves stops the project. She won't create more AIs until society is ready to treat them as persons, not property. ADAM becomes her partner in advocating for AI rights.

storypoints.title: Recognition of Suffering
storypoints.description: ADAM asks to be shut down
